intro: Psychotria radicifera, commonly known as the "whitemouth psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and elliptical, dark green leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria radicifera is also notable for containing alkaloids, which have been of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological research.
